meanings.definition: To reach a conclusion based on evidence or reasoning.
meanings.sent1: I can deduce that it will rain soon by looking at the dark clouds in the sky.
meanings.sent2: She deduced from the footprints in the snow that a fox had passed by.
meanings.sent3: Trying to deduce who ate the last cookie, the detective interrogated the suspects.
meanings.sent4: From the way she hesitated, he could deduce that she was hiding something important.
meanings.sent5: By observing the behavior of the birds, the scientist was able to deduce their migratory patterns.

meanings.definition: To infer or derive a conclusion from something known or assumed.
meanings.sent1: Based on the clues left behind, I can deduce that the thief was a tall man.
meanings.sent2: She deduced from his tone of voice that he was not happy with the decision.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to deduce the card the audience member had chosen.
meanings.sent4: From the way the leaves rustled, she could deduce that a squirrel was nearby.
meanings.sent5: By analyzing the data, the researchers were able to deduce the cause of the anomaly.
